title.narrative: CHILD PROTECTION AND SOCIAL SERVICES SYSTEMS

description.narrative: New Element, which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Cross Sectoral - Children With Disabilities, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2025, national legislative and implementation systems increasingly provide for a protective and caring family environment that enables families and children to demand and benefit from enhanced access to and use of community-based child and family services, quality alternative care, justice system, and protection systems against violence in all environments.

participating-org.narrative: LEPL AGENCY FOR STATE CARE AND ASSISTANCE FOR THE STATUTORY VICTIM OF HUMAN TRAFFIKING

sector.narrative: Alternative care reform and service provision
Ending violence against women and girls
Research, evaluation and other evidence generation and use - Care
Response and support services for girls, boys, and women experiencing violence, exploitaiton, abuse and neglect
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Strengthening the social welfare workforce and direct outreach to families

related-activity.ref: 1600/A0/06/884 CHILD PROTECTION, ALTERNATIVE CARE AND JUVENILE JUSTICE

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: New Element

description.narrative: UNICEF was a convening agent to mobilize stakeholders on deinstitutionalization, facilitating a constructive dialogue between all parties. By focusing on the best interests of children, a common understanding of the DI process was created; the main directions of the DI reform identified; and recommendations developed and shared with the Government for further consideration for the national DI strategy and action plan. UNICEF supported the development of a model for assessment and crisis intervention.UNICEF is supporting the establishment of an integrated service for child victims of sexual abuse including development of Standard Operational Procedures and training of 90 professionals. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:22/12/2021

title.narrative: New models of community-based family and child support and alternative care services tested and mechanisms in place for roll out, Text

target.value: 2025:Georgia - 2 services regulated in the national legislation; Abkhazia - New alternative care model fully functional and adopted by responsible stakeholders

actual.value: 2021:Specialized family type service for sevier and profound disabilities established in line with UNICEF proposed concept in 2 locations

An alternative care policy in line with the 2009 Guidelines for the Alternative Care of Children is available in the country (23-03-L3-01), Text

baseline.value: Some prevention services exist Separation is conducted without court system involvement Needs of individual children in alternative care are not taken into consideration A review mechanism to ensure more sustainable solutions for children in alter

target.value: 2025:Improved capacity of the national institutions to implement the alternative care policies

actual.value: 2021:Main directions of the National Strategy and Action Plan on DI identified and agreed
